text: Working Woman was an American magazine that ceased publication in September 2001 after 25 years. ==History and profile== Working Woman was first published in November 1976. The magazine was acquired by Lang Communications in 1978. It was published on a monthly basis. The magazine and its sister publication Working Mother were sold to MacDonald led by Jay MacDonald in 1996. The magazine were later published by Delia Passi Smalter. As its name implies, the magazine targeted working women, unlike traditional women's magazines which focused on women's roles as wives and mothers, or on fashion. ==References== ==Additional Information== *Working Woman Magazine letters, 1976-2001, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College *Handmade and Personalised Mother's Day Gift Ideas Category:Monthly magazines published in the United States Category:Defunct women's magazines published in the United States Category:Magazines established in 1976 Category:Magazines disestablished in 2001 Category:Magazines published in New York City
title: Working Woman (magazine)
